flawed_nl_solution:
Susan picked 3 times as much as 36 which is 3*36 = <<3*36=180>>180 apples
She gave out half which is 180*(1/2) = <<180*(1/2)=90>>90 apples
She now has 180-90 = <<180-90=90>>90 apples
Frank sold a third of 36 which is 36*(1/3) = <<36*(1/3)=12>>12 apples
Frank now has 36-12 = <<36-12=24>>24 apples
Altogether they now have 90+24 = <<90+24=114>>114 apples

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 108, not 180. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
